intro: Onixotis punctata, commonly known as the spotted rock cress, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its basal rosette of linear, hairy leaves and produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in a raceme. The plant is typically found in rocky or gravelly habitats, often in alpine or arctic regions. Its leaves are covered in fine hairs, which help to reduce water loss in harsh environments. Onixotis punctata is a perennial species that thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to cold climates.
